column4: How can I login via remote desktop even if didn't activate it? I can access my machine thru ssh so is there anything I can set so I can use VNC to connect to it?
if you just need one particular app and have broadband you can simply ssh -X to that machine
cool :) tx :) but I would like to use my own VNC app :) X is so slow btw I would have to install an other VNC app on my mac too... :S
can't I just activate the remote desktop option thru ssh ? so I can normally vnc the thing?
on the long run i'd check x11vnc .. less bloated than vino, more flexible and only uses half of the cpu time (compared to vino)
cool I'll do that next but first I'll have to make a connection via VNC at first... because now I can only access the machine thru ssh
sudo apt-get install x11vnc ... then run it :-)
and I would like to be able to give it some commands in X too (I'm no ssh guru although I'm getting better)
but it will still not let me connect
and make sure that vino is not in the way (hogging port 5900)
evil admin.... no bedtime story tonight :-) ... don't use root !
I'm evol :D and I hate typing sudo (A)
ok face it I'm laisy :P but the thing is a internal server :) so I'm not that worried :)
i think that's a built in security feature. it won't let connect root to an xsession
new output with the user mike http://pastebin.com/d490d3e7d
